description: Unlock the mysteries of the quantum world, relativity, and the atomic nucleus.

slides.title: The Quantum Revolution
slides.content:
# Beyond Classical Physics ‚öõÔ∏è

Around 1900, classical physics couldn't explain certain phenomena.
- Blackbody radiation
- Photoelectric effect
- Atomic spectra

This led to **Quantum Mechanics**: The physics of the very small.

slides.title: Photoelectric Effect
slides.content:
# Particles of Light üí°

Observed: Shining light on metal ejects electrons.
Einstein's Explanation:
- Light comes in packets of energy called **Photons**.
- Energy depends on **Frequency**, not intensity.

$$E = hf$$

This proved light acts like a particle!

slides.title: Wave-Particle Duality
slides.content:
# Identity Crisis üé≠

- Light acts like a wave AND a particle.
- **De Broglie Hypothesis**: Matter (like electrons) also has wave properties!

$$\lambda = \frac{h}{momentum}$$

This is why electron microscopes work.

slides.title: Bohr Model of the Atom
slides.content:
# Planetary Orbits ü™ê

Niels Bohr proposed:
- Electrons orbit nucleus at fixed energy levels.
- They can "jump" levels by absorbing/emitting a photon.

This explained the specific colors (spectrum) emitted by Hydrogen.

slides.title: Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle
slides.content:
# Nature is Fuzzy üå´Ô∏è

It is impossible to know both the exact **position** and **momentum** of a particle simultaneously.

$$\Delta x \Delta p \ge \frac{h}{4\pi}$$

It's not a measurement error; it's a fundamental property of nature.

slides.title: Quantum Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: According to quantum mechanics, light behaves as:
quizOptions: Both a particle and a wave

slides.title: Special Relativity
slides.content:
# Einstein's Big Idea üöÄ

Two Postulates:
1. Laws of physics are the same in all inertial frames.
2. **Speed of light ($c$) is constant** for all observers, regardless of motion.

This leads to weird consequences at high speeds!

slides.title: Relativistic Effects
slides.content:
# Warping Reality ‚è≥

At speeds close to $c$:
1. **Time Dilation**: Moving clocks run slower.
2. **Length Contraction**: Moving objects get shorter.
3. **Mass Increase**: Moving objects gain mass.

You can't travel faster than light!

slides.title: Mass-Energy Equivalence
slides.content:
# The Famous Equation üí•

$$E = mc^2$$

- energy ($E$) and mass ($m$) are interchangeable.
- Small mass = HUGE energy.
- This is the source of power for stars and nuclear reactors.

slides.title: Nuclear Structure
slides.content:
# The Core ü•ú

**Nucleus** contains:
- **Protons** (+)
- **Neutrons** (0)

Held together by the **Strong Nuclear Force** (strongest force in nature!).

**Isotopes**: Same element, different number of neutrons.

slides.title: Radioactivity
slides.content:
# Unstable Nuclei ‚ò¢Ô∏è

Some nuclei decay naturally to become stable.

Types:
- **Alpha ($\alpha$)**: Helium nucleus emitted. Stopped by paper.
- **Beta ($\beta$)**: Electron/Positron emitted. Stopped by wood.
- **Gamma ($\gamma$)**: High energy photon. Stopped by lead.

slides.title: Nuclear Fission
slides.content:
# Splitting the Atom ü™ì

A heavy nucleus (Uranium) splits into lighter nuclei, releasing massive energy.

- Chain reactions.
- Used in Nuclear Power Plants and Atomic Bombs.

slides.title: Nuclear Fusion
slides.content:
# Power of Stars ‚òÄÔ∏è

Light nuclei (Hydrogen) fuse to form heavier nuclei (Helium).

- Releases even MORE energy than fission.
- Requires extreme temps (millions of degrees).
- Clean energy Grail (Scientific goal).

slides.title: Standard Model
slides.content:
# The Particle Zoo ü¶Å

All matter is made of:
1. **Quarks**: Make up protons/neutrons.
2. **Leptons**: Electrons, neutrinos.
3. **Bosons**: Force carriers (Photon, Gluon).

The **Higgs Boson** gives particles mass.

slides.title: Schr√∂dinger's Cat
slides.content:
# Quantum Superposition üêà

A thought experiment.
- A cat in a box is simultaneously alive AND dead until observed.
- Quantum systems exist in all possible states (**Superposition**) until measured.
- Measurement causes "Wavefunction Collapse".

slides.title: Semiconductors
slides.content:
# Electronics Foundation üíæ

Band Theory:
- **Valence Band**: Electrons stuck.
- **Conduction Band**: Electrons free to move.
- **Band Gap**: Energy needed to jump.

Silicon has a small gap. Heat or voltage can make it conduct.

slides.title: Lasers
slides.content:
# Coherent Light üî¶

**L**ight **A**mplification by **S**timulated **E**mission of **R**adiation.

- Electrons are pumped to high levels.
- One photon triggers a cascade of identical clones.
- Result: Monochromatic, directional, intense beam.

slides.title: Modern Physics Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Quantum**: Nature is granular and probabilistic.
- **Relativity**: Space and time are flexible; $E=mc^2$.
- **Nuclear**: Massive energy in the atom's core.

Modern physics transformed our understanding of reality, giving us lasers, GPS, computers, and nuclear energy!
